document.p: The dynamic DNS service allows you to assign a dynamic DNS host name (for example mywebpage.dyndns.org) to a broadband connection even if it is using a dynamic IP address. As soon as the device gets a new IP address, the dynamic DNS server updates its entry to the new IP address.
The DynDNS section the WAN services page allows you configure the following settings:
document.li1:
Enabled:
Allows you to enable or disable DynDNS.

Service Name:
The DynDNS T that you are using.

Domain:
The domain name that you received from you DynDNS provider.

User Name:
The user name of you DynDNS account.

Password:
The password of you DynDNS account.
